clinical_study.brief_title: Application of MR-PET in Colorectal Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Application of MR-PET in Colorectal Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: This study will explore the potential value in proper therapeutic decision and clinical outcome prediction by using integrated MR-PET system and advanced MR techniques in patients with colorectal cancer.

detailed_description.textblock: This research expect that the image techniques and experience in this cancer group may be valuable and helpful for others. With advantage of MR-PET in better soft tissue delineation/functional information and less radiation dose than PET-CT, the ultimate goal in both research and clinical application is to establish new diagnostic standard and management guideline by MR-PET, which can further improve clinical outcome and disease prognosis in patients colorectal cancer.

primary_outcome.measure: The recurrence rate at 1 year after surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: The overall survival at 1 year after surgery

intervention.intervention_name: The imaging biomarkers determined by MR-PET
intervention.description: This study will explore the potential value in proper therapeutic decision and clinical outcome prediction by using integrated MR-PET system and advanced MR techniques in patients with colorectal cancer.

study_pop.textblock: This is a prospective cohort study. Patients with 50 newly diagnosed colorectal cancers and 50 patients with suspicious recurrent colorectal cancers will be enrolled.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Group 1: Patients with newly diagnosed colorectal cancers
2. Group 2: Patients with suspicious recurrent colorectal cancers
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Age <20 or >90 years old
2. Contraindication for MRI: claustrophobia or MR non-compatible devices
3. Contraindication for MR contrast medium: severe adverse reaction or impaired renal function (Cre > 2.0)
4. History of other malignancy
5. Prior arthroplasty of hip (may cause artifacts on MRI)
6. Pregnancy
